thread.title: Backcountry bike trails open in new state forest land in central Adirondacks
thread.title_full: Backcountry bike trails open in new state forest land in central Adirondacks - Winnipeg Free Press

author: The Associated Press
title: Backcountry bike trails open in new state forest land in central Adirondacks
text:
NEWCOMB, N.Y. - Nearly 20 miles of dirt roads through the state's new Essex Chain Lakes complex in the central Adirondacks are now open to bicyclists.
State Department of Environmental Conservation Commissioner Joe Martens says the management plan for the lake-studded forest between Indian Lake and Newcomb is intended to promote tourism and expand recreational opportunities.
The Essex Chain tract is already a popular destination for canoeists and kayakers.
The state is completing an official management plan for the Essex Chain area and is taking public comments until July 27. The plan would make bicycle access permanent, but the state is opening up temporary access now.
From several parking areas, bikers will be able to ride to the Cedar River, the Iron Bridge on the Hudson River, around Deer Pond, to Pine Lake and to Jackson Pond.
